sentences: Mickey Oliver is an American musician, who was born on the South Side of Chicago.
The City of Chicago recognized Mickey's accomplishments by naming a street after him, “Mickey Mixin Oliver Blvd”.
One of his first releases, "In-Ten-Si-T" (1988), which was co-written and produced by Jim "Cheese" Romano, is considered one of the Top 10 most influential House music records.
In 1987, he produced "Never Let Go", which became a hit.
In 2011, Oliver charted on Billboard Magazine's Dance Music Club Play chart with his single release "As Days Go By" featuring Baton Rouge (LA) singer Kim Smith on the Intensi-T label.
Oliver remixed the single "Zoon Baloomba" which topped out on the Billboard chart at #21 on November 18, 2012.
